name: Why I Hate Holidays Quiz / Test | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: I don't like costumes and candy, which indicates my dislike of which holiday?
questions.explanation:
Halloween.

	Halloween is a holiday that is a remembrance of our loved ones who have died. It may have origins in ancient Celtic fall festivals. It is celebrated on October 31.

questions.text: Because I don't like St. Nicholas, I don't like which holiday?
questions.explanation:
Christmas.

	This festival commemorates the birth of Jesus Christ. Christmas trees, presents, and St. Nicholas or Santa Clause are parts of the holiday. It is celebrated in all Christian countries.

questions.text: I do not like anything heart-shaped or anything that has to do with love, including which holiday?
questions.explanation:
Valentine's Day.

	Valentine's Day is a celebration of love and romance. It is celebrated on February 14th in many countries around the world.

questions.text: I don't like wearing green or Irish customs, which tells you I don't like which holiday?
questions.explanation:
St. Patrick's Day

	The holiday celebrating the Irish and their culture is St. Patrick's Day. Shamrocks, leprechauns, a dressing in green are all part of the celebration on March 17th.

questions.text: I don't like trees or which holiday that relates to them?
questions.explanation:
Arbor Day.

	This is a holiday celebrating trees and planting new trees. Arbor Day is celebrated in spring on April 26th.

questions.text: I don't like working nor which holiday in honor of working people?
questions.explanation:
Labor Day.

	The contributions that working people have made to the country are celebrated on Labor Day. This fall holiday usually is celebrated by BBQ's, picnics, and parades. And a day off from work.

questions.text: I do not like to hunt for eggs or care for bunnies which tells you I probably don't like which holiday?
questions.explanation:
Easter.

	Easter is a celebration of the resurrection of Jesus Christ. It is also a cultural spring festival which includes Easter egg hunts, Easter bunnies and candy.

questions.text: I don't like fireworks or staying up until midnight so I probably don't like which holiday?
questions.explanation:
New Year's.

	New Year's is celebrated throughout many countries of the world to mark the end of one year and the start of a new one. Fireworks and staying up to midnight are part of the celebration in America.

questions.text: I don't like turkey or pumpkin pie thus I don't like which holiday?
questions.explanation:
Thanksgiving.

	Thanksgiving is a national holiday celebrated in Liberia, Canada, the USA, and the Caribbean. It is a fall celebration in thanks for the crops and food obtained throughout the year.

questions.text: Because I am afraid of fireworks and parades, I don't like which holiday?
questions.explanation:
Independence Day.

	Fireworks are a big part of Independence Day in the US, also called the 4th of July. Parades, picnics and BBQ's are part of the celebrations that mark the country's independence from the British.
